item.title: Project management is expected to face challenges in 2015
item.description:
ESI International, a company that provides project management training, believes that in the coming year, project managers (PMs) will experience several changes. These include dealing with combined in-person and remote work environments, needing stronger talent management skills, and aligning project results with company goals. Raed Haddad, Managing Director for Asia Pacific at ESI International, noted that strategy and execution are often discussed separately. He anticipates a stronger emphasis on connecting these two aspects, as more companies start seeing strategic execution as a crucial skill...
